ratings.comment: Professor Samuels is very nice! Exams are fairly easy, assuming you have done the readings throughout the semester. Memorization is not required, but you are expected to apply key terms and central themes on exams papers. Expect to have 25 pages of weekly textbook reading, and to read a memoir on your own time (5 page essay on final exam).

It's a theory class. Level of difficulty is weird: clearly too hard for most of the class, but not actually very rigorous. Take-home exams. Great class if you want to read Foucault, Haraway and some body theorists, but it's not set up to provide you with much critical engagement.

Samuels class was really easy! she is really understanding of everyones busy lives so the workload isnt bad... I really enjoyed her class for the most part it was an easy A. TA's are all weird and don't really take the time to know you but still easy A

Professor Samuels is nice enough, but overall this class is pretty useless. Take a different GWS class, like 103 which is amazing. She provides a lot of time for review, but the class is still difficult because the standards for grading are so high. Assignments are also not well explained. I wouldn't recommend this class.
Passionate teacher and very clear in presenting information. I would definitely recommend her!
Super easy class, attendance for lecture and section are mandatory, there are weekly readings but many are very interesting, exams are not difficult at all, very passionate about what she teaches

Prof. Samuels is fantastic. She is one of the most important scholars in women's/disability studies. It is not an easy class, but you get far more than you put in. she cares a lot about the students. The whole GWS department is amazing, but she's especially so.

Hard readings and theories but Ellen makes it easy. Discussions are interesting and even fun, especially the class presentations. 1 easy take home exam, and 2 critical papers plus a presentation. Work load is pretty light and learning about Foucault will help in other classes. Not a bad theory class!
Ellen Samuels is an amazing professor and has tons of real life experience relating to what she teaches.  She is passionate and all around an awesome person.  Take any class she teaches!

Go to class; it counts for part of your grade and she goes over all reading material in class.  Take good notes, as this is what you need for your midterms, etc. The tests are NOT bad as long as you do the readings.

Great class! Material is interesting and Samuels does a great job of making it clear what you need to know. Midterms are fairly easy if you do your readings. A lot of reading but if you attend lecture you basically know what readings you need to do and not. Definitely take this class if you can!

Where to start - boring lectures, ridiculous in class exercises, she is about as sharp as a pillow and the icing on the cake has to be her stubborn and useless TA rules. Take ENG 217  with the other prof if you can, he shows movies, reads graphic novels. Samuels, not so much...so RUN AWAY if you can

I was so enthusiastic coming into this class that it ended up being a disappointment. If you come in with any sort of feminist viewpoint or knowledge the class is a piece of cake. The TAs grade the essays and exams so easily it's hard not to get an A. Samuel's lectures kept me engaged but did not challenge me or make me question my positions.
Really great class, loved the TA's.  She does a great job of lecturing, kept me interested.

The class could be interesting but I  many of the topics are trivialized by statements that are made by Prof Samuels. She often makes radical comments that are taken out of context that trivializes the issues that are the foundation of women's studies. The class itself is interesting enough, but I find it hard to go because it is so frustrating.

Great class to take for fun. Lectures were always very interesting, along with the assigned readings.  Midterms and paper aren't painful at all.  Prof Samuels is one of the nicest professors on campus.
Lectures use a variety of mediums. The class was maybe a bit slow, but good coverage in general.
If you've already taken ws 103, this class will be a breeze! It's a little repetitive sometimes, but overall I loved it! And she uses youtube, etc to emphasize points.

She's a really funny professor. Her lectures are entertaining and she relates many things to current events/topics and shows youtube clips often. Def do the readings. Exams are short answer and essay based. Know the names of the authors that you read, you'll need to reference them in essays and exams. Really great class. I would highly recommend it

The class is amazing! There's a lot of reading & some of it's pretty dense, but it's good stuff and Ellen is easy to talk to so it isn't too bad. She's got a great sense of humor and has most of the class periods run as discussions. There's a reading response due every Monday, but the grade is on whether or not you turn them in, not what you write.
